column4: does anyone know how i do this?  "Step 2. Turn on sound support from kernel config (soundcore module, default turn on)"
that is already done in ubuntu kernels
are you compiling your own kernel ?
ok thanks. no im not. im trying to get my sound working by installing the package from the realtek site
http://pastebin.com/m3990ba33 'snd-xxxx is the card ID.' how do i find out my card id?
lspci | grep -i audio
http://pastebin.com/m6461315b so snd-Intel Corporation 82801JI ?
HD Audio Controller --> snd-hda-intel
thanks
!ru | skazi21101
in http://pastebin.com/m3990ba33 it says 'Edit your /etc/modules.conf or conf.modules depending on the distribution' i get this http://pastebin.com/mdc0c07e
/etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base.conf <<<< maybe ?
k one sec

in http://pastebin.com/m3990ba33 it says 'Edit your /etc/modules.conf or conf.modules depending on the distribution' then it shows the text underneath it, above 'Copy and paste this to the bottom of your /etc/modules.conf or /etc' so they want me to copy and paste the line that starts with '-- Azalia controller --ALC880 ALC882 ' into 'alsalbase.conf?
no; the other lines the ones that begin with # ALSA portion
here http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=85581 it says its '/etc/modules'
so y were they telling me about 'snd-xxx is the card if they didnt want me to copy and paste or do anything with what's above '# ALSA portion'
you have to replace the snd-xxxx in the paste with the card id
so they wwant me to change that line in the modules.conf that they provided?
ok wait i think i understand this now
i wish i could find that file though
i dont know what to do. i want to install this driver but neither /etc/modules.conf or conf.modules exist
the doc may be out of day
i found a thread about my exact issue and noone has responded http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1040522
